objectives: Students will discuss food and dining out using Informal/Conversational register language
Students will engage with Thriller/Suspense themed scenarios related to food and dining out
Students will demonstrate appropriate use of informal level vocabulary and expressions
Students will create dialogues combining food and dining out content with Thriller/Suspense narrative elements

warm_up.description: Students explore food and dining out through a Thriller/Suspense lens using Informal/Conversational language
warm_up.scenario: Imagine a dangerous or threatening situation involving food and dining out

main_activities.description: Students learn and practice informal register vocabulary related to food and dining out in a thriller context
Students engage in thriller themed role-play about food and dining out using informal register
Students create original thriller themed content about food and dining out in informal register

discussion_questions: How would you describe food and dining out in a Thriller/Suspense scenario?
What suspense or threat might be involved in food and dining out?
Can you create a Thriller/Suspense story about food and dining out?
How does food and dining out change when viewed through a Thriller/Suspense perspective?
What informal register expressions would you use to discuss this thriller scenario?

role_play_scenarios.scenario: Thriller/Suspense situation involving food and dining out
roles: Character A: Using informal register in thriller context
Character B: Responding in informal register within thriller theme

topic_genre_blend: food and dining out with suspense
food and dining out with threat
food and dining out with danger

teacher_transformation_guide.register_guidance: Use Informal/Conversational throughout: Friendly, relaxed everyday speech
teacher_transformation_guide.genre_guidance: Frame all content with Thriller/Suspense theme: Tension, danger, psychological intensity

assessment.register_focus: Students demonstrate mastery of Informal/Conversational register
assessment.genre_focus: Students engage with Thriller/Suspense themed content
criteria: Appropriate use of informal register language
Comprehension of topic within new context

methodology: Augmented CLT with Register & Genre Transformation
